headers.subject: [tosdr:3179] Wordfeud [Bad] Delete account

html:
The discussion that is linked to the Wordfeud page directs me to a post that has nothing to do with Wordfeud, so I thought it'd be better to make a new one.

ToSDR states that "It is impossible to delete your account from this service, according to the AccountKiller blacklist."

Although it is indeed not possible to delete your account via a webpage, the ToS of Wordfeud (and AccountKiller) states that "You may terminate your account at any time and for any reason by sending an email to support@wordfeud.com". (See http://wordfeud.com/tos/ under par. 6) Therefore I wouldn't say that it is impossible to delete your Wordfeud-account. On the contrary, you're allowed to delete your account at all times.

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
---

subject: Wordfeud [Bad] Delete account
text:
The discussion that is linked to the Wordfeud page directs me to a post 
that has nothing to do with Wordfeud, so I thought it'd be better to make a 
new one.

ToSDR states that "It is impossible to delete your account from this 
service, according to the AccountKiller blacklist 
<http://www.accountkiller.com/en/Blacklist>."

Although it is indeed not possible to delete your account via a webpage, 
the ToS of Wordfeud (and AccountKiller) states that "You may terminate your 
account at any time and for any reason by sending an email to 
support@wordfeud.com". (See http://wordfeud.com/tos/ under par. 6) 
Therefore I wouldn't say that it is *impossible *to delete your 
Wordfeud-account. On the contrary, you're allowed to delete your account at 
all times.

-- 
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
